content.description: To the right of Iceberg Arete, Start under the roof, on the left facing block, with right cramp, left slopper. Make big fist move to sloping rail.
content.location: to the right of Iceberg Arete

content.description:
Start as for

Iceberg Arete

with hands on either side of the arete but instead of moving right continue straight up past several horizontals to a mantle finish.
content.location: The obvious arete on the right side of the north face.

content.description:
Start from good holds on either side of the arete and work up and right following the hanging arete to a mantle finish far right of the start.

Fun movement throughout on this problem that climbs more like a route. A spot is nice, especially at the finish as you're directly over a block.
content.location: The obvious arete on the right side of the north face.

content.description:
Start crouched with hands on a horizontal and make a reach up and left for a thin slot, then a good sidepull and on to jugs over the lip. An easy mantle concludes the problem.

Rated V3 in the bouldering guide but it seems comparable to the nearby

Iceberg Arete Direct

.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #686, Unnamed.
content.location: Far right side of the west face.

content.description:
Standing start with hands matched on the obvious sloping shelf and make tricky moves up past a series of horizontal cracks to finish with a large sidepull/crack.

Due to the sloping nature of the crux holds it's probably best to do this when it's cooler.
content.location: Left side of the north face.
